title: The week in tennis: Sinner cements the No. 1 ranking, Nadal sets retirement date
description: Sinner will end the year at No. 1 -- while Sabalenka has a chance to as well. And Nadal confirmed his final tournament.
author: D'Arcy Maine

title: Forehands, titles and what-ifs: How Rafael Nadal broke tennis math
description: As Rafael Nadal announces his upcoming retirement, it's worth remembering just how much he stands out when looking at the raw numbers.
author: Bill Connelly

title: The Best Tennis Players Do These 3 Things - Essential Tennis Podcast #412
description: If you want to be a great tennis player then you MUST do the three things revealed in this special episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast, PERIOD. The best players on your local courts do them and the weakest ones don’t, so don’t miss any of these insights because they’ll level up your game fast.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: 3 Advanced Doubles Tactics - Essential Tennis Podcast #411
description: If you’re a doubles player looking to take your game to the next level then this is the episode of the Essential Tennis Podcast you've been waiting for. You’re about to learn 3 advanced tactics that will pressure your opponents and win you free points.
author: Essential Tennis LLC

title: Off-court coaching to be allowed in tennis from 2025
description: Off-court coaching will be allowed in tennis from January 2025, governing body the International Tennis Federation (ITF) announces.

title: Sabalenka replaces Swiatek as world number one
description: US Open champion Aryna Sabalenka rises to number one in the WTA rankings, ending Iga Swiatek's 11-month stay at the summit.

title: What is the Vienna tennis schedule?
description: The action at the Erste Bank Open continues Tuesday in Vienna, where Alex de Minaur will continue his push for a debut appearance at the Nitto ATP Finals. Among the other players in action will be Dominic Thiem, who is competing in his final tournament this week. The Austrian faces Luciano Darderi. View the full Tuesday order of play below to see who is competing, on which court, and when they are scheduled. [ATP APP] ORDER OF PLAY - TUESDAY, 22 OCTOBER 2024 Center Court - start 2 p.m. Jan-Lennard Struff (GER) vs [2] Alex de Minaur (AUS) [5] Frances Tiafoe (USA) vs Cameron Norrie (GBR) Not Before 6 p.m. [WC] Dominic Thiem (AUT) vs Luciano Darderi (ITA) [WC] Kei Nishikori (JPN) vs [7] Jack Draper (GBR) #Glaubandich - start 12 p.m. Miomir Kecmanovic (SRB) vs Mariano Navone (ARG) Not Before 2 p.m. Alex Michelsen (USA) vs Marcos Giron (USA) [Q] Quentin Halys (FRA) vs Gael Monfils (FRA) Lorenzo Sonego (ITA) vs [6] Lorenzo Musetti (ITA) Not Before 5 p.m. [WC] Robin Haase (NED) / Alexander Zverev (GER) vs [2] Rohan Bopanna (IND) / Matthew Ebden (AUS) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: What is the Basel tennis schedule?
description: The Swiss Indoors Basel main draw continues Tuesday. Stars who will be in action include big-serving American Ben Shelton, Holger Rune and Stefanos Tsitsipas. View the full Tuesday order of play below to see who is competing, on which court, and when they are scheduled. [ATP APP] ORDER OF PLAY - TUESDAY, 22 OCTOBER 2024 Center Court - start 2 p.m. [WC] Dominic Stricker (SUI) vs Tallon Griekspoor (NED) Followed By Tomas Martin Etcheverry (ARG) vs [6] Ben Shelton (USA) Not Before 6 p.m. Nicolas Jarry (CHI) vs [4] Holger Rune (DEN) [3] Stefanos Tsitsipas (GRE) vs Francisco Cerundolo (ARG) IWB Court 1 - start 12 p.m. Yuki Bhambri (IND) / Albano Olivetti (FRA) vs Jean-Julien Rojer (NED) / Joe Salisbury (GBR) [WC] Denis Shapovalov (CAN) vs Juncheng Shang (CHN) [Q] Botic van de Zandschulp (NED) vs Alexander Bublik (KAZ) Marin Cilic (CRO) vs Alejandro Tabilo (CHI) Followed By After Suitable Rest - Arthur Fils (FRA) / Ben Shelton (USA) vs Tallon Griekspoor (NED) / Pedro Martinez (ESP) [NEWSLETTER FORM]

title: Jannik Sinner’s Doping Scandal: Why the Silence from Tennis Media?
description: When news broke that Italian tennis star Jannik Sinner tested positive for the banned substance clostebol twice, one might have expected a media storm. After all, doping scandals in sports, especially involving top athletes, usually lead to days, if not weeks, of intensive coverage, punditry, and endless headlines. Yet here we are, two months later, …
author: Jonathan

title: Sinner Defeats Djokovic to Win Shanghai Rolex Masters
description: Jannik Sinner is the 2024 Shanghai Masters champion after defeating Novak Djokovic 7-6(4), 6-3. Another clean performance from him and the typical display of precision hitting that has propelled him to the world’s number-one spot this season. The Italian headed in as the betting favourite, and after a tight first set that resulted in a …
author: Jonathan
